page.title: 15LANDSCAPE ISLE OF DOGS
page.content: It is very obrious that this area is undergoing considerable change in the mid 1980's. Small, compact, terrace housing estates,wharehouses some derelict, industries such as timber, metallurgy all servs as reminders of the recent past when the area was part of the great port of london. Here were situated the West India and Millwall docks receiving cargo boats which had s travelled up the river Thames from the open sea.All the docks are now closed and the subject of a great deal of land reclamation.It is an area designated as an "enterprise zone" encouraging new businenes and develoment. High technology industry office development. A hypermarket luxury flats are now all part of the changing face of the Isle of Dogs.
